WhatsApp launches Catalog, a virtual showcase for companies' products (photos and videos)
An integrated interface within the app that allows users to consult the catalog without leaving WhatsApp, soon also in Italy
07 Nov 2019, 16:45 by Enrico Paccusse
One of the most complicated tangles to untangle for Mark Zuckerberg, since he decided to spend 19 billion to acquire WhatsApp, is how to monetize the application.
Mainly for this reason, in 2018 WhatsApp Business was launched, the counterpart dedicated to companies that want to offer services to their customers through the application.
At first, the only noteworthy features were automatic replies, and other advanced tools for customer analysis. Now it's time to take the next step: make WhatsApp a marketplace.
The first step in this sense is to give companies a virtual showcase, through which to show their products / services to potential buyers: this is the purpose of the Catalog - the new functionality available today in the US, UK, Germany, Mexico, India, Brazil and Indonesia and "soon" in the rest of the world.
As illustrated by the official video available below, the product insertion process is quite simple and allows you to add links and identification codes, as well as image and price, which you can then share in chat with interested parties.
It seems that it is not yet possible to finalize the purchase directly in the application, but this could be the next step. Who knows, maybe with the help of the much discussed Libra.
